JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Join HydrogenPro – Pioneering the Future of Renewable Energy!

Are you a detail-oriented financial expert with a passion for driving project success?

HydrogenPro is seeking a Financial and Project Controller to ensure the financial integrity and operational excellence of our innovative projects.

The Role

As the Financial and Project Controller, you will report directly to the General Manager of HydrogenPro’s Danish subsidiary and oversee the financial and operational health of R&D and production projects. You will collaborate with internal teams and external partners to ensure compliance, optimize processes, and drive project success. This role is critical for managing public funding, maintaining financial transparency, and supporting organizational growth.


Key Responsibilities

  1. Financial Management
    • Prepare accurate and timely financial reports in compliance with IFRS
    • Develop and manage forecasts, analyze variances, and provide actionable insights
    • Ensure compliance with tax laws, labor regulations, and public funding requirements
    • Monitor cash flow and optimize the use of funds

  1. Project Oversight
    • Collaborate with project managers to establish budgets and track financial performance
    • Monitor project expenditures, ensuring alignment with public funding agreements
    • Prepare detailed project financial reports for stakeholders and funders
  2. Process Improvement
    • Identify and implement efficiencies in financial reporting and project management workflows
    • Leverage technology to automate repetitive tasks and enhance data accuracy
    • Standardize templates and procedures to ensure compliance and streamline operations
  3. Compliance and Risk Management
    • Act as the primary point of contact for audits related to public funding.
    • Identify financial risks and implement strategies to mitigate them

 
What we are looking for

Required Qualifications:

  • Degree in finance, accounting, or a related field
  • 3–5 years of experience in financial or project controlling
  • Experience in managing public grants and subsidies, including compliance and audits
  • Solid understanding of IFRS
  • Knowledge of local/EU funding regulations
  • Proficiency in ERP systems and advanced Excel skills
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, with the ability to present financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders
  • Fluency in English (written and oral)

Personal Attributes:

  • Proactive and resourceful problem-solver
  • Strong ethical grounding and commitment to compliance
  • Positive, team-oriented mindset with a hands-on approach
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Team player

What We Offer

At HydrogenPro, we are proud to be empowered by a diverse workforce. We are committed to fostering a supportive work environment where equal opportunity, diversity, and inclusion are integral to our success. Diversity enriches our workplace, attracts top talent, and enhances creativity - essential elements for driving the future of sustainable energy.

What you can expect when joining us:

  • Flexibility: Enjoy the option to work remotely up to two days per week and flexible working hours to support your work-life balance
  • Competitive Compensation: We strive to provide a salary package that reflects your skills and experience, while balancing the flexibility and benefits we offer
  • Professional Development: As part of a close-knit team, you'll have unique opportunities for autonomy and direct collaboration with leadership, fostering meaningful professional growth

 Location

This position is based in our Århus, Denmark, office.

Application Process

If you’re excited about making an impact and joining the green hydrogen revolution, we’d love to hear from you. 

We welcome qualified applicants from diverse backgrounds to join our innovative international team and help shape the future of sustainable energy.

All inquiries will be treated confidentially, and applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

About HydrogenPro

 HydrogenPro, established in 2013, specializes in pioneering green hydrogen technology solutions in partnership with global collaborators and suppliers. Our flagship products are high-pressure alkaline electrolyzers, featuring some of the most advanced technology available.

Our team comprises highly skilled professionals, including key experts in green hydrogen solutions. 

As an original equipment manufacturer (OEM), HydrogenPro is certified to ISO 9001, ISO 45001, and ISO 14001 standards, ensuring the highest levels of quality, safety, and environmental responsibility.

Our mission is clear: to be the #1 provider of large-scale green hydrogen technology and systems, accelerating global decarbonization with world-class solutions. By combining well-proven high-pressure electrolyzer technology with advanced electrode innovations, we enable our customers to achieve significant operational cost savings, solidifying our position as the preferred OEM in the industry. Designed for scalability with renewable energy inputs, our electrolyzers offer costeffective solutions crucial for enhancing sectors like wind, solar, and other renewables in the energy transition.

HydrogenPro is a publicly listed company on the Oslo Stock Exchange with a global presence, including locations in Norway, Denmark, Germany, USA, and China.

Join us in shaping the future of energy as we lead the charge in the green hydrogen revolution. By powering innovation, we are energizing tomorrow. We are changing the world. For good.
